Method Detail

Same_Move_P

public boolean Same_Move_P(online.game.commonMove oth)
This is used to check for equivalent moves "as specified" not "as executed", so it should only compare those elements that are specified when the move is created.

Specified by:
Same_Move_P in class online.game.commonMove
Returns:
true if these moves are the same move

public void Copy_Slots(Hexmovespec to)

Copy

public online.game.commonMove Copy(online.game.commonMove to)
Description copied from class: online.game.commonMove
create a copy of this move. The default method calls Copy_Slots, which is probably the method that should be overridden or wrapped.

Specified by:
Copy in class online.game.commonMove
Returns:
a Copy of this move. This copy should include any modifications and/or annotations that were made when the move was executed.

shortMoveString

public java.lang.String shortMoveString()
construct an abbreviated move string, mainly for use in the game log. These don't have to be parseable, they're intended only to help humans understand the game record.

Specified by:
shortMoveString in class online.game.commonMove
Returns:
a short, nonparseable representation of this move for use in the game log.

moveString

public java.lang.String moveString()
construct a move string for this move. These are the inverse of what are accepted by the constructors, and only secondarily human readable

Specified by:
moveString in class online.game.commonMove
Returns:
a parseable string representing the move

longMoveString

public java.lang.String longMoveString()
longMoveString is used for sgf format records and can contain other information intended to be ignored in the normal course of play, for example human-readable information

Overrides:
longMoveString in class online.game.commonMove

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
standard java method, so we can read moves easily while debugging
